oneOf.description: The Resource name with the following regex pattern for the name ^(?![0-9]+$)(?!-)[a-zA-Z0-9-]{2,49}[a-zA-Z0-9]$

maxDeliveryCount.description: The max delivery count for the device queue. Range: 1-100

defaultTtlAsIso8601.description: The default time to live for the device queue. Range: 1 Min (PT1M) - 2 Days (P1D)

CloudToDeviceProperties.description: The Iot Hub Cloud-To-Device messaging properties

routes.description: The list of routing rules that users can provide, which the IoT hub uses to route messages to various in-built and user-provided endpoints. A maximum of 100 routing rules is allowed for paid hubs and a maximum of 5 routing rules is allowed for free hubs.

fallbackRoute.description: The properties of the route that will be used as a fallback route when none of the conditions specified in the 'routes' section are met.

RoutingProperties.description: The routing related properties of the IoT hub. See: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/iot-hub/iot-hub-devguide-messaging

serviceBusQueues.description: The list of service bus queue endpoints to which IoT hub routes the messages to, based on the routing rules.

serviceBusTopics.description: The list of service bus topic endpoints to which IoT hub routes the messages to, based on the routing rules.

eventHubs.description: The list of eventhub endpoints to which IoT hub routes the messages to, based on the routing rules. This list should not include the in-built eventhub endpoint.

RoutingEndpoints.description: The properties related to the user-provided endpoints to which IoT hub routes the messages to, based on the routing rules. A maximum of 10 endpoints is allowed across all endpoint types for paid hubs and a maximum of 1 endpoint is allowed across all endpoint types for free hubs.

connectionString.description: The connectionstring for the event hub endpoint.

name.description: The name of the event hub endpoint.

id.description: The identifier of the endpoint. This will be set by the server. Modifying this value causes create or update IoT hub operations to fail. Pass id as null when specifying a new endpoint. Pass the same id that you get for an endpoint from the service when specifying an existing endpoint during update operations.

subscriptionId.description: The subscription identifier of the service bus event hub endpoint.

resourceGroup.description: The name of the resource group of the event hub endpoint.

connectionString.description: The connectionstring for the service bus queue or topic endpoint.

name.description: The name of the service bus queue or topic endpoint.

id.description: The identifier of the endpoint. This will be set by the server. Modifying this value causes create or update IoT hub operations to fail. Pass id as null when specifying a new endpoint. Pass the same id that you get for an endpoint from the service when specifying an existing endpoint during update operations.

subscriptionId.description: The subscription identifier of the service bus queue or topic endpoint. This is optional.

resourceGroup.description: The name of the resource group of the service bus queue or topic endpoint. This is optional.

RoutingMessagingEndpointProperties.description: The properties related to service bus queue or topic endpoint types.

name.description: The name of the route. The name has to be unique and cannot start with a $, also the route name should not exceed 64 characters.

source.description: The source to which the routing rule is to be applied to. e.g. DeviceMessages

condition.description: The condition which is evaluated in order to apply the routing rule. If the condition is not provided it will evaluate to true by default. For grammar, See: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/iot-hub/iot-hub-devguide-query-language

endpointNames.description: The list of endpoints to which the messages that satisfy the condition are routed to. Currently only 1 endpoint is allowed.

isEnabled.description: Used to specify whether a route is enabled or not.

RouteProperties.description: The properties related to a routing rule based on which the IoT hub routes messages to endpoints.

retentionTimeInDays.description: The retention time in days. Range of values [For F1: 1-1, S1: 1-7, S2: 1-7, S3: 1-7].

partitionCount.description: The partition count. Range of values [For F1: 2-2, S1: 2-128, S2: 2-128, S3: 2-128].

EventHubProperties.description: The properties of the provisioned event hub used by the Iot Hub

lockDurationAsIso8601.description: The lock duration for the feedback queue. Range: 5 Sec (PT5S) - 5 Min (PT5M)

ttlAsIso8601.description: The time to live for the feedback queue. Range: 1 Min (PT1M) - 2 Days (P2D)

FeedbackProperties.description: The Iot Hub Feedback Queue properties

storageEndpoints.description: The list of storage endpoints where files can be uploaded. Currently only one storage account can be configured.

enableFileUploadNotifications.description: The flag which indicates whether file upload notification should be enabled. This is optional at iot hub level. When enabled upload notifications will be available.

ipFilterRules.description: The IP filter rules. Each rule specifies if a source IP address or a range of source IP addresses should be accepted or rejected when connecting to a IotHub.

features.description: The Capabilities/Features that need to be enabled for the Hub. Possible values include: 'None', 'DeviceManagement'

name.description: The name of the Sku. Possible values include: 'F1', 'S1', 'S2', 'S3'

capacity.description: The number of units being provisioned. Range of values [For F1: 1-1, S1: 1-200, S2: 1-200, S3: 1-10]. To go above this range, call support.

IotHubSkuInfo.description: The Sku related information for the hub.

SharedAccessSignatureAuthorizationRule.description: The properties that describe the keys to access the IotHub artifacts.

sasTtlAsIso8601.description: SAS time to live. Range: 1 Min (PT1M) - 1 Day (P1D)

connectionString.description: The account key credentials for storage account selected by customer for uploading files

containerName.description: The root container name where all files will be uploaded

StorageEndpointProperties.description: The properties of the Storage Endpoint provided by the customer for file upload

oneOf.description: The name of the IP filter rule with the following regex pattern.
The action desired - accept or reject.

ipMask.description: A string containing the IPAddress/range in CIDR notation such as 192.168.0.0/24.
